title: Should the word 'interestingly' be used in an informative essay despite sounding opinionated? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depends on how you use it. I’d honestly avoid emotional language, loaded terms or general fallacies, or use of ly modifiers. I’m trying to think of a good reason to use "interestingly" in an informative essay, and I can’t think of anything that wouldn’t be better re-worded. If you’re going for something along the lines of, ‘interestingly though,’ in order to ‘inform’ a reader about something, then do avoid it. That’s known as throat clearing. That’s not to say there’s no real reason to ever use it, tho—just ’cause i can’t think of a reason to.

I would not find your inclusion of ‘interestingly’ either opinionated. The purpose of your essay is to ‘inform’. You had to do research, you found an interesting fact, you want to share it. ‘interestingly’, to me, sounds as if you enjoyed your research and that you also learned something. Makes you sound human.
